meanings.definition: A long, sturdy piece of timber or metal set upright in the ground and used as a support or marker.
meanings.sent1: The post marked the boundary of the property.
meanings.sent2: She leaned against the post while waiting for the bus.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel used the post as a lookout point for acorns.
meanings.sent4: The post stood tall like a guardian of the garden.
meanings.sent5: The post was so heavy, it took two people to lift it into place.

meanings.definition: A job or position in an organization.
meanings.sent1: Her dream was to get a post in the company's marketing department.
meanings.sent2: The manager announced a new post opening in the sales team.
meanings.sent3: The post of team leader came with added responsibilities.
meanings.sent4: She aspired to reach a high post within the organization.
meanings.sent5: The post of CEO required strong leadership skills.

meanings.definition: To display or publish something online.
meanings.sent1: She would post updates about her travels on social media.
meanings.sent2: He decided to post a picture of his new puppy on his blog.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to post a selfie but ended up taking a nap on the keyboard.
meanings.sent4: The artist would post his latest creations for his followers to see.
meanings.sent5: She planned to post a video tutorial on her channel next week.

meanings.definition: To send or submit something for consideration or publication.
meanings.sent1: He needed to post his application before the deadline.
meanings.sent2: She would post her article to the editor for review.
meanings.sent3: The student forgot to post his homework assignment on time.
meanings.sent4: They decided to post their research findings in a scientific journal.
meanings.sent5: She hurried to post her entry for the writing competition.
